result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittney Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -CASH BOND APPLIED.  Forfeiture and costs totalling $330.50 have been paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:58 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Sara Kneevers.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Kneevers - State will be amending to ordinance.  DA moves to amend to City of Berlin ordinance Disorderly Conduct in violation of 46-1 adopting state statute with a forfeiture plus costs.  Atty Kneevers enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the amended charge.  Court finds the defendant Guilty.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Kneevers.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 forfeiture plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court orders bond on file be applied to the forfeiture and costs and any balance be refunded to the poster.

Court adjourned at 11:02 a.m.
and Inspection
(Atty Sara Kneevers)
Status hearing on November 20, 2018 at 10:30 am.

9:34 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant previously issued.  Statement by Atty Roeth - defendant qualifies for PD representation, and defendant requests a reduction in bond.  No position by DA.  Court reduces to $500 cash bond.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 20, 2018 at 10:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:35 a.m.

9:08 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 9:09 a.m.
Bond Agency Payments / Check #9479
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement

10:05 a.m. Defendant present via video, from the Green Lake County Jail, in custody, without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the defendant - wishes to be physically present for this hearing. Court temporarily adjourned at 10:06 a.m.

Case recalled at 10:09 a.m. Same appearances - with defendant now present in person. Court quashes the warrant. Defendant gives current address. Court instructs the defendant on her right to an attorney. Statement by DA regarding missed appearance. DA gives bond recommendation. Defendant requests signature bond. Court sets bond at $1500.00 cash bond. 

Court sets for status hearing on October 23, 2018 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

10:18 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for ten days.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing at 01-11-2016 09:30 am
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

8:51 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $150 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 11, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:52 a.m.
